result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devin Lattrez Seaberry

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devin Lattrez Seaberry in Court with Attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**  
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material; however, has NOT received an offer from the State. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:00 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Jury Trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated July 28, 2022; received and filed.

22RM029066  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriffs
05/25/2022

Defendant Devin Lattrez Seaberry in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  **JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Defense needs an offer letter and additional time to review. Case is adjourned in Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

JusticePoint contacted the Court regarding next Court date/entry from Preliminary hearing.
Defendant advised JusticePoint that his orange slip noted June 3, 2022 at 01:45 pm as his next Court date. 
Branch 46 is DOWN the afternoon of June 3, 2022. Clerk contacted the parties via email to reschedule. 

NEXT COURT DATE: Status/Scheduling hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 10:45 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. 
Information provided to both parties and JusticePoint.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Devin Lattrez Seaberry in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack, appear by video.  Defendant Devin Lattrez Seaberry in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court toom judical notice to case 13CF462 Sworn for the State: Detective M. Driscoll.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46. Defense wants to be heard on bail.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Gregg H. Novack in court, defendant Devin Lattrez Seaberry not in court, in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present; military leave. Defense moves to dismiss. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Order Appointing Counsel at County Expense - NO REIMBURSEMENT FROM DEFENDANT; signed and filed.
Attorney Gregg Novack

Defendant Devin Lattrez Seaberry in Court with Attorney Thomas Holland Reed on behalf of the Public Defender's Office. Defendant Devin Lattrez Seaberry in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Order to Show Cause hearing. Parties appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Discussion placed on the record. Public Defender's Office has NOT been able to appoint counsel for Defendant. Court found Defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. Court contacted Attorney Gregg Novack. Court ordered the Defendant DOES NOT REIMBURSE THE COUNTY. Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Preliminary hearing scheduled May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm before Commissioner Phillips.

Order to Show Cause hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
DEFENDANT WILL BE PRODUCED.

Defendant Devin Lattrez Seaberry not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. SPD needs more time to appoint representation. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for an Order to Show Cause hearing in Br. 46.  Hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devin Lattrez Seaberry not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Detective Finkley was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Case charged by ADA Owen Piotrowski. Per Chief Judge Directive 21-13, this case is transferred to Judge Feiss, Branch 46.

Defendant Devin Lattrez Seaberry not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DAW, dob 2/5/1991 and EAT, dob 11/19/2000, and CO-Actor: Billy Evans.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Devin Lattrez Seaberry in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Devin Lattrez Seaberry in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Devin Lattrez Seaberry appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
